intro: Kokoona sabahana, commonly known as the Malaysian orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its roots are adapted for absorbing moisture from the air. Kokoona sabahana plays a vital role in the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
